Title: ASP.NET Core and E-commerce
Description: This quiz tests your knowledge of ASP.NET Core and its advantages in building robust and scalable e-commerce applications.

Options: A) A front-end framework for building user interfaces.
B) A cross-platform, high-performance framework for building modern, cloud-based, internet-connected applications.
C) A database management system.
D) A programming language.
Questions.Explanation: ASP.NET Core is a cross-platform, high-performance framework developed by Microsoft for building modern, cloud-based, internet-connected applications, including web apps, APIs, microservices, and more.

Questions.Text: Which of the following is a key feature of ASP.NET Core that benefits e-commerce platforms?
Options: A) Its ability to run only on Windows.
B) Integrated development environment (IDE) dependency.
C) High performance and scalability.
D) Limited support for third-party libraries.
Questions.Explanation: ASP.NET Core is known for its high performance and scalability, making it an excellent choice for e-commerce platforms that need to handle a high volume of transactions and users efficiently.

Questions.Text: Why is cross-platform support in ASP.NET Core important for e-commerce development?
Options: A) It allows applications to run on multiple operating systems, reducing hosting costs.
B) It restricts the application to only one type of operating system.
C) It makes the application more difficult to maintain.
D) It decreases application security.
Questions.Explanation: Cross-platform support in ASP.NET Core allows applications to run on various operating systems such as Windows, Linux, and macOS, providing flexibility in hosting and reducing costs.

Questions.Text: How does ASP.NET Core ensure secure e-commerce transactions?
Options: A) It uses basic HTML forms for security.
B) It integrates with advanced security protocols like HTTPS, data encryption, and identity management.
C) It relies solely on the client's security measures.
D) It does not offer built-in security features.
Questions.Explanation: ASP.NET Core integrates with advanced security protocols like HTTPS, data encryption, and provides comprehensive identity management features, ensuring secure e-commerce transactions.

Questions.Text: Which ASP.NET Core feature helps improve the performance of e-commerce websites?
Options: A) ViewBag and ViewData.
B) Dependency Injection.
C) Razor Pages.
D) Built-in caching mechanisms.
Questions.Explanation: ASP.NET Core includes built-in caching mechanisms that can significantly improve the performance of e-commerce websites by reducing the load on the server and speeding up response times.

Questions.Text: What is the role of middleware in an ASP.NET Core application?
Options: A) To handle user interface design.
B) To manage server-side scripting.
C) To process requests and responses in the application pipeline.
D) To manage database connections.
Questions.Explanation: Middleware in ASP.NET Core is a crucial component that processes requests and responses as they pass through the application pipeline. It can handle tasks like authentication, logging, and error handling.

Questions.Text: Which database systems are commonly used with ASP.NET Core for e-commerce applications?
Options: A) SQL Server and MySQL.
B) Microsoft Excel and Access.
C) MongoDB and Notepad.
D) SQLite and CSV files.
Questions.Explanation: ASP.NET Core is commonly paired with relational databases like SQL Server and MySQL, which are well-suited for managing the complex data requirements of e-commerce applications.

Questions.Text: How does ASP.NET Core support responsive design for e-commerce websites?
Options: A) It forces desktop-only layouts.
B) It integrates with front-end frameworks like Bootstrap.
C) It removes CSS styling.
D) It uses inline HTML styling.
Questions.Explanation: ASP.NET Core supports responsive design by integrating seamlessly with front-end frameworks like Bootstrap, which allows developers to create websites that adapt to different screen sizes and devices.

Questions.Text: Why is dependency injection important in ASP.NET Core for e-commerce applications?
Options: A) It tightly couples the application components.
B) It allows developers to replace services with mock implementations during testing.
C) It increases code redundancy.
D) It prevents the application from scaling.
Questions.Explanation: Dependency injection is important in ASP.NET Core because it promotes loose coupling and testability by allowing developers to replace services with mock implementations during testing.

Questions.Text: What is the significance of Razor Pages in ASP.NET Core?
Options: A) They provide a simplified model for building UI with server-side logic.
B) They are used exclusively for database management.
C) They replace HTML entirely.
D) They are only for client-side scripting.
Questions.Explanation: Razor Pages in ASP.NET Core offer a simplified model for building web user interfaces with server-side logic, making it easier to create dynamic and responsive e-commerce pages.
